content: Maybe I am missing something but could it be that the tar archive (linux download) on the website is wrong/damaged?
I tried downloading/extracting on two separate machines and I get a ".... Damaged archive... " error on both.
It is most likely a trap by Makarius to make sure that you use the RC1 version https://isabelle.in.tum.de/website-Isabelle2021-RC1/ :grinning:
(I believe the webpages are sync'ed once a day)

Hi :) not sure if this is the correct place, but I have an issue getting Isabelle2021 to work. After installing it and launching Isabelle2021.exe, it says "I/O error: C:\Users\User\.isabelle\Isabelle2021\ROOTS (Das System kann den angegebenen Pfad nicht finden)". I installed Isabelle into C:\Users\User\Isabelle, and there is a ROOTS file at C:\Users\User\Isabelle\Isabelle2021\ROOTS. The C:\Users\User\.isabelle folder is completely empty.
Hm, I now got it to work by installing into a folder named "IsabelleFolder" instead of "Isabelle".
hello everyone, I would like to make my own isabelle editor using javascript, could someone tell me where to find the indicated repository?
The Isabelle repository as linked on https://isabelle.in.tum.de/ is at https://isabelle-dev.sketis.net/source/isabelle/ (start with the instructions in the README_REPOSITORY).
I cannot judge on the feasibility to develop your own editor in javascript, but you could try the VSCode integration
note that the currently released VSCode integration isn't working particularly well but an update should be published soonish
